reasons.title_1: TOP-5 reasons to come to the profession of Data Analyst
list_1: High salaries (up to 3000 USD per month)
High and rising demand on the market
Big potential of further career growth
reasons.title_2: What does a Data Analyst do?
list_2: Collecting, mining, and analyzing sales and market information
Evaluating consumer purchasing habits and patterns
Evaluating consumer purchasing habits and patterns
Designing data collection and evaluation tools
Creating projections and reports based on their findings
reasons.label: The Bureau of Labor and Statistics (U.S.) expects the number of hired Data Analysts to grow by 25% during the decade from 2020 to 2030.

preview.title: Explanation of the Data Analyst position
preview.subtitle: This course is for those who want:
preview.item_1: Get into new highly paid profession
preview.item_2: Work remotely with top world companies
preview.item_3: Get promotion on your actual job position

list.title: Learn all of the skills
list.text: And tools, and processes you need to become a data analyst

list.title: Work 1:1 with an expert mentor and tutor

list.title: Build an impressive portfolio
list.text: Out of the real-world projects you complete

list.title: Land a job as a data analyst
list.text: Within 180 days of graduating from the program — or your money back

structure.title: Course structure

list: What is data analytics?
Difference between data analytics and data science
Different types of data analysis
Some data analytics real-world case studies
What does a data analyst do?
What is the typical process that a data analyst will follow?
Tools and techniques do data analysts use
Statistics from basics
Descriptive Statistics - Mean, Mode, Median, Standard Deviation, Variance and Interquartile Range
Probability Distributions - Normal, Binomial and Poisson
Statistical tests
Preparation of data and data cleaning
Creating flexible data aggregations using pivot tables
Representing data visually using pivot charts
Calculating margins and other common ratios using calculation on pivot table
Filtering data using slicers in multiple pivot tables
Creating aggregate reports using formula based techniques

support.title: Career Support
support.desc: Your personal career manager will guide you through the employment process right until your job offer
list: Help in creation of CV and motivation letter
Review of LinkedIn and other social networks account
Navigation through the list of potential employers
Preparation for the interview with practical simulation (mock interview)
Vacancies from our partners

guarantees.title: Job Guaranteed
guarantees.desc: As our team works in tight cooperation with HR-departments of top companies on the market, our course is built in such a way that it assures you to correspond to all requirements of potential employers after graduation.
guarantees.subtitle: We guarantee that you will get a job after successful completion of this course in case if you:
list: Pass all modules according to the course timeline
Complete all tasks before their deadlines
Successfully pass the final attestation
Follow the guidelines of the Career Center

slider.name: Zebadiah Dongoran
slider.text: After completing this course, I successfully got a job as a data analyst at Biwabits. The information in the course is well structured, practical tasks help to quickly gain the necessary skills.

registration.title: Start your career in data analytics right now
registration.label: Early birds offer:

questionArray.text: Yes, the program is entirely online, so you can study when and wherever you’d like. At the same time, the program is filled with a lot of interaction with your teacher and other students, so you definitely won't feel lonely.

questionArray.ttl: Can I study only one module that I am most interested in?
questionArray.text: The course is a complete system, specially designed to become a highly professional data analyst. Viewing the course in parts will not give the desired effect, so this is not possible.

questionArray.ttl: Are there some requirements for the job guarantee?
questionArray.text: There are a number of conditions that graduates must meet in order to receive a job guarantee. You must complete 100% of the course and complete all assignments, complete the free Job Ready course, follow the recommendations of career counselors, and submit at least 5 job requests per week during 6 months.

questionArray.ttl: How many hours per week do I need to work on this course?
questionArray.text: Typically, the learning process and assignments take from 4 to 10 hours a week.
